snippet: Troubling testimony emerges from a third stop-and-frisk case against the New York Police Department.
abstract: Editorial expresses concern at troubling testimony that has emerged from stop-and-frisk cases before federal courts, which has compared life in New York City public housing project to living in 'penal colony'; contends city needs to settle these suits and ensure that police policies adhere to Fourth Amendment guarantees of freedom from unreasonable search and seizure.
lead_paragraph: Troubling testimony emerges from a third stop-and-frisk case against the New York Police Department.

headline.seo: New York City Public Housing as a ‘Penal Colony’
